Constructor Detail

SignedSAMLAssertion

public SignedSAMLAssertion(SAMLNameID issuer,
                           SAMLSubject subject,
                           SAMLConditions conditions,
                           java.util.List<SAMLStatement> statements,
                           SAMLSigner signer)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                           java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                           java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                           javax.xml.crypto.MarshalException,
                           javax.xml.crypto.dsig.XMLSignatureException
Construct from the components and a signer. This generates a signature with the help of the signer.

Parameters:
issuer - the issuer of the assertion
subject - the subject of the assertion, can be null
conditions - the conditions associated with this assertion, can be null
statements - the statements
signer - a signer for generating the signature, or null if we don't want a signature
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException
javax.xml.crypto.dsig.XMLSignatureException
javax.xml.crypto.MarshalException
java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

getIssuer

public SAMLNameID getIssuer()
Returns the issuer of the assertion. This is the issuer element of the SAML assertion.

public java.util.Date getIssueInstant()
Gets the date and time of issuing. This is the IssueInstant attribute of the SAML assertion.

the time instant when the assertion was issued

getSignature

public org.w3c.dom.Element getSignature()
Returns:
the signature element of this assertion

isValid

public void isValid()
             throws VerificationException
Check is the assertion is valid now according to the validity interval in the conditions. If there is no Conditions element the Assertion is considered to be valid.

Throws:
VerificationException - if the assertion is not valid

isValid

public void isValid(java.util.Date date)
             throws VerificationException
Check is the assertion is valid at the given date according to the validity interval in the conditions. If there is no Conditions element the Assertion is considered to be valid.

Parameters:
date -
Throws:
VerificationException
